changes.value: Rebuild hero into a 2-column grid on desktop (60/40): left = H1, 3-bullet value summary, primary+secondary CTA; right = a static “visibility panel” preview card (audit-style activity feed + status chips). On mobile, stack with the preview card below CTAs and cap hero height to ~80vh to avoid pushing CTAs below the fold.
changes.rationale: Improves above-the-fold clarity and makes the “hand it off without losing control” promise tangible via an audit/visibility preview, while keeping the primary conversion action immediately accessible.
risks: Preview panel may require design/dev time to implement cleanly

changes.value: Place the primary CTA as the first button in hero and repeat it once within the first 600px of scroll (same component). Add a short inline form option (email only) directly under the primary CTA on desktop; keep it behind a tap on mobile to reduce clutter.
changes.rationale: Creates a clear conversion path for lead generation without forcing users to hunt for contact actions, while keeping mobile cognitive load low.
risks: Inline form can reduce clarity if spacing is tight on smaller laptops

changes.value: Enable a sticky primary CTA on mobile after 40% scroll, pinned bottom with 56px height and safe-area padding; include a secondary text link inside the bar (not a second button) to avoid choice overload.
changes.rationale: Sustains conversion access during scrolling and reduces drop-off on long pages, especially for small business owners browsing on mobile.
risks: Sticky bar can conflict with chat widgets or cookie banners

changes.value: Reorder homepage flow to: Hero → Proof bar → Problem/Solution → How it Works → Trust/Observability (auditability) → Services/Suite → Pricing → FAQ → Footer. Keep each section to a single primary intent and avoid back-and-forth between features and trust.
changes.rationale: Reduces cognitive load by grouping narrative (why/what/how) before details (services/pricing) and placing auditability before pricing to justify value.
risks: Existing internal links/anchors may need updates

changes.value: Add a proof bar directly under hero (desktop) and after hero stack (mobile) with 3–5 compact items (logos, metrics, certifications placeholders) using a single-row horizontal scroll on mobile and a 5-column grid on desktop with 24px gaps.
changes.rationale: Improves immediate trust and scannability without adding a full testimonial section; supports lead conversion early.
risks: Needs credible proof assets; placeholders could feel empty

changes.value: Merge problem + solution into one section using a two-column layout on desktop: left = 3 problem bullets, right = 3 solution bullets; add a subtle before/after card pair below (2 cards) to visualize outcomes. On mobile, convert to an accordion-like stacked list (max 6 items) to keep it under ~500–650px height.
changes.rationale: Increases hierarchy and scannability, prevents repetitive scrolling, and clarifies the transformation quickly for time-constrained owners.
risks: If bullets are long, the section can still feel dense

changes.value: Convert How it Works into a 3-step numbered sequence with a horizontal stepper on desktop and vertical stepper on mobile; keep each step to a short checklist (3 items max) and add a midpage CTA after step 2.
changes.rationale: Creates a clearer mental model of engagement and introduces a natural conversion moment once users understand the process.
risks: Requires tightening existing content to fit step constraints

changes.value: Introduce an “audit log” pattern section: a lightweight activity feed component (8–12 rows) with timestamps, owner/assignee, and status chips; include filters (All / This Week / Completed) as non-interactive UI affordances if needed. Place it above Services/Suite.
changes.rationale: Strengthens trust via auditability/observability rather than hype, showing ongoing responsibility with visibility into what’s happening.
risks: Must avoid implying real-time monitoring if not provided

changes.value: Adopt a calm, premium type scale with explicit max line length: H1 48px/1.08 (mobile 34px/1.12), H2 32px/1.15 (mobile 26px/1.2), H3 22px/1.25, body 16–18px/1.6, caption 13px/1.45; set global content max-width to 65ch for paragraphs and 42ch for hero lead text; use tabular-nums for metrics and log timestamps.
changes.rationale: A restrained scale with controlled measure improves readability and reduces perceived noise, supporting calm confidence and operational clarity (especially for audit/log UI).
risks: Existing layouts may need reflow to accommodate 65ch constraints
Large H1 may require tighter hero spacing on small laptops

changes.value: Standardize vertical spacing rhythm between sections: 96px desktop / 64px tablet / 48px mobile; within sections use a 24px stack gap for headings-to-body and 16px for item lists; cap dense sections (e.g., audit log preview) to ~520px height on desktop with internal scroll only if >12 rows.
changes.rationale: Consistent spacing creates a calmer, more premium cadence and prevents operational UI elements from overwhelming the page.
risks: Tighter sections may feel sparse if imagery is removed
Internal scroll regions can be missed by some users if not signposted visually

changes.value: Define a clear button hierarchy with safe-by-default states: Primary = solid fill, 44px min height, 16px horizontal padding, 10px radius; Secondary = outline 1px; Tertiary = text button with 8px vertical padding; add focus ring 2px (offset 2px) visible on all backgrounds; hover transition 150ms, active scale 0.98; disabled at 40% opacity + no shadow; loading state uses inline spinner and preserves width.
changes.rationale: Strong hierarchy reduces choice overload while consistent states and focus treatment improve perceived safety and accessibility.
risks: Outline secondary may look too light on very pale backgrounds without contrast tuning
Scale-on-active can feel jumpy if used inside tight layouts

changes.value: Move to a premium, low-noise card spec: 12px radius, 1px neutral border, no heavy drop shadows; default padding 24px desktop / 16px mobile; use a 4px left accent border only for “operational” cards (e.g., audit log preview) and keep card density to max 3 content blocks (title, body, meta row).
changes.rationale: Border-forward cards read calmer and safer than shadow-heavy surfaces, while a restrained accent cue communicates operational status without visual clutter.
risks: Cards may blend into the background if neutral tokens are not sufficiently separated
Accent border could be overused if not governed by usage rules

changes.value: Introduce proof + status chips with consistent sizing: 28px height, 12px horizontal padding, 999px pill radius; text 13px/1.2 with medium weight; variants: Neutral (bordered), Success/Warning/Info (tinted background at ~8–12% with 1px border); include optional leading icon at 14px; ensure chip rows wrap with 8px gap and cap to 2 lines before collapsing into “+N” on mobile.
changes.rationale: Chips provide compact, scannable proof and status signaling (auditability) while keeping the UI calm and structured.
risks: Tinted variants can fail contrast if colors are not calibrated
Chip overflow handling adds implementation complexity

changes.value: Standardize a “proof bar” and “proof grid” pattern: proof bar uses 3–5 items, 5-column grid desktop with 24px gaps; mobile uses horizontal scroll with 16px item padding and snap points; each item is a compact card with logo/metric + 1 meta line, no more than 2 lines of text; apply subtle divider line above/below proof bar (1px).
changes.rationale: Creates early trust without hype by presenting proof in a restrained, repeatable layout that feels premium and operational.
risks: If proof assets are inconsistent (logo sizes), the bar can look messy
Horizontal scroll can reduce discoverability of all items

changes.value: Define an audit-log preview component language: 8–12 row feed, each row 44px min height with a 12px left gutter; columns: timestamp (tabular-nums), actor, action, status chip; row separators 1px; hover highlights row with 4% neutral fill; include a non-interactive filter pill group (All / Week / Completed) styled as chips; show “immutable” indicator icon in header at 16px.
changes.rationale: A consistent log pattern communicates observability and safety-by-default through familiar operational UI cues, increasing trust without adding marketing claims.
risks: May imply real-time capabilities if the UI looks too interactive
Table-like layouts can wrap poorly on narrow screens without truncation rules

changes.value: Shift neutrals to a calmer, higher-contrast ramp: background #FFFFFF / #F7F8FA surfaces; borders at ~#E3E6EA; primary text at ~#111827; secondary text at ~#4B5563; ensure minimum contrast 4.5:1 for body text and 3:1 for UI icons; use a single neutral shadow token only for elevated overlays (e.g., menus) at 0 8px 24px rgba(17,24,39,0.12).
changes.rationale: A disciplined neutral palette with explicit contrast targets feels premium and safe, while limiting shadows reduces visual anxiety.
risks: Existing brand colors may clash with the proposed neutral ramp
If borders are too light, component boundaries may be unclear on some displays

issues.description: Hero may read like software UI, not consulting, hurting 8-sec comprehension.
issues.rationale: If visitors think it's a tool, they won't click; confusion happens before any scroll.

issues.description: Inline email form under hero CTA can add friction and reduce clicks.
issues.rationale: Forms trigger hesitation; above-fold friction can drop lead intent before value is absorbed.

issues.description: Sticky CTA at 40% scroll may appear too late for fast deciders.
issues.rationale: Users who decide early may scroll a bit then lose the action; continuity breaks mid-flow.

issues.description: Conditional: Sticky bar may overlap cookie/chat, blocking content and taps.
issues.rationale: Overlaps create rage taps and hidden CTAs; mobile conversion path becomes unreliable.

issues.description: Section order adds many blocks; narrative may feel long before pricing/CTA.
issues.rationale: Scroll fatigue increases abandonment; users may never reach pricing or FAQs to resolve doubts.

issues.description: Problem/Solution bullets risk dense scanning; key outcomes may be buried.
issues.rationale: Owners skim; dense bullets reduce retention and delay the moment they feel 'this is for me'.

issues.description: Pricing table may be hard to compare on mobile without clear emphasis/stacking.
issues.rationale: If comparison requires effort, users postpone decision; pricing becomes a drop-off point.

issues.description: Audit log UI can imply real-time monitoring; trust hit if service isn't that.
issues.rationale: Over-promising via UI cues creates skepticism; trust breaks right before contacting.

issues.description: Visibility panel preview may be too subtle; proof of control could be missed.
issues.rationale: If users don’t notice it, the main differentiator fails; hero loses persuasive power.

issues.description: Type scale + 65ch constraints may cause awkward reflow in hero on small laptops.
issues.rationale: Bad wraps and tall hero push CTAs down; readability and action suffer above the fold.

suggestedFixes.fix: Add explicit H1: 'Done-for-you consulting' + 1-line scope; label panel 'Project visibility example (sample)'.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Prevents 'software product' misread and anchors the offer within 8 seconds.

suggestedFixes.fix: Default to button-only; move email capture to step-2 modal or below fold; test form only on desktop ≥1200px.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Reduces above-fold friction while preserving lead capture for motivated users.

suggestedFixes.fix: Trigger sticky CTA at 15–20% scroll or after hero exits; keep 56px height with clear label 'Book a call'.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Maintains action access earlier for fast deciders without waiting mid-page.

suggestedFixes.fix: Add collision rules: offset above cookie/chat by 8–16px; auto-hide on input focus; respect safe-area inset.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Prevents overlap and tap failures that silently kill mobile conversions.

suggestedFixes.fix: Compress to fewer blocks: merge Trust/Observability into How-it-works; add midpage CTA after Proof bar + Step 2.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Shortens path to action and reduces scroll fatigue while keeping narrative intact.

suggestedFixes.fix: Enforce bullet max 10–12 words; add 3 outcome chips (e.g., 'More time', 'Clear scope', 'Visible progress').
suggestedFixes.rationale: Improves skim speed and ensures outcomes land quickly for busy owners.

suggestedFixes.fix: On mobile, stack tiers as cards with 1 primary plan highlighted; show 3 key rows + 'See all' expand.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Reduces comparison effort and clarifies the decision without horizontal scrolling.

suggestedFixes.fix: Add 'Sample view' badge + disclaimer line; remove hover states; keep filters visibly non-interactive (disabled).
suggestedFixes.rationale: Avoids implying real-time tooling and protects trust by matching actual service.

suggestedFixes.fix: Increase panel prominence: min 320px width, 16px padding, 1px border; add header 'You always know what's next'.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Makes the differentiator noticeable and ties UI preview to the promise.

suggestedFixes.fix: Add breakpoint at 1024–1280px: H1 40px, hero lead max 38–42ch, tighten hero vertical padding by 16–24px.
suggestedFixes.rationale: Prevents ugly wraps and keeps CTAs above fold on small laptops.
